SENT.plain: Headache represents up to 4% of all emergency department (ED) visits
Emergency physicians generally are concerned with identifying those patients whose headaches are caused by life-threatening conditions
Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis may be difficult to diagnose clinically because of its various and nonspecific manifestations
The most frequent but least specific symptom of sinus thrombosis is severe headache, which is present in more than 90% of adult patients
In the case report we present, a patient had severe headache and was diagnosed until third ED visit at different hospitals
He had one of the most unusual causes of headache, that is, cerebral venous sinus thrombosis due to hyperthyroidism
